intro: Dorstenia tayloriana var. laikipiensis, commonly known as the Laikipia dwarf banana, is a unique member of the Musaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, banana-like leaves. Native to the high-altitude regions of Kenya, it thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by edible, banana-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
